title: Pythagoras for Rafter Length
summary: Calculate rafter length from rise and run.
whenToUse: Use for right triangles like rafters, braces, or set-out lines.
steps: Convert rise and run to the same unit.
Square both values and add them.
Take the square root to get the rafter length.
commonMistakes: Using pitch ratio instead of actual rise/run.
Rounding too early before the square root.
siteTips: Check the rafter length against a tape measure on site.
Allow for birdsmouth or overhang adjustments separately.
verification: Rafter length should be slightly longer than the run.
